\documentclass{article}
\usepackage{amsmath}
\usepackage{graphicx}
\usepackage{hyperref}

\title{Sample LaTeX Document for VimTeX Testing}
\author{Test Author}
\date{\today}

\begin{document}

\maketitle

\section{Introduction}
This is a sample document for testing VimTeX functionality including:
\begin{itemize}
    \item Syntax highlighting
    \item Completion
    \item Compilation
    \item Error detection
\end{itemize}

\section{Mathematics}
Here's an inline equation: $E = mc^2$.

And a display equation:
\begin{equation}
    \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} e^{-x^2} dx = \sqrt{\pi}
\end{equation}

% Test completion: \begin{

\subsection{Matrices}
\begin{equation}
    A = \begin{bmatrix}
        1 & 2 & 3 \\
        4 & 5 & 6 \\
        7 & 8 & 9
    \end{bmatrix}
\end{equation}

% Intentional error: undefined command
\someundefinedcommand{test}

% Missing closing brace
\textbf{Bold text

\section{References and Citations}
See Figure \ref{fig:example} for an example.

% Missing figure environment will cause warning
\label{fig:example}

\section{Code Listings}
\begin{verbatim}
def hello_world():
    print("Hello, LaTeX\!")
\end{verbatim}
